mean_answer:
To clean a fish tank:

1. Unplug the filter, heater, and air pump. Siphon out 1/3 of the water into a bucket. 

2. Remove any decorations and scrub them clean under hot running water. Use a toothbrush or bristled brush to remove any stuck-on algae or residue. Rinse well. 

3. Vacuum the gravel using a siphon vacuum. Slowly move the vacuum along the gravel to remove waste and debris. Empty the waste bucket as needed. 

4. Scrub the glass with an algae scraper or pad to remove any algae or buildup. 

5. Rinse the filter media in the old tank water to remove gunk. Never use tap water as it can kill beneficial bacteria. 

6. Wipe down the outside of the tank and lid. Clean the tank light if needed.

7. Refill the tank with dechlorinated water that is the same temperature as the old water. 

8. Reassemble everything and turn all equipment back on. Add water conditioner. 

9. Let the tank sit for 20-30 minutes, then slowly reintroduce the fish.

• Acoustic keyloggers: These record the sound of typing using a microphone to try and determine what keys were pressed.
